content.title: FnuPlot
content.body: A lightweight F# wrapper for gnuplot, enabling the creation of various types of plots and charts.

content.title: FSharp.Charting
content.body: A charting library suitable for interactive F# scripting, providing a range of chart types for data visualization.

content.title: FSharp.Plotly
content.body: An F# interactive charting library using Plotly.js, offering a wide array of interactive plots.

content.title: XPlot
content.body: A collection of older plotting libraries for F#, utilizing Plotly and Google Charts as backends.

content.title: FsPlot
content.body: An interactive data visualization library for F# powered by FunScript, supporting Google Charts and Highcharts.

content.title: Deedle
content.body: An open library for data and time series manipulation, supporting structured data frames and time series.

content.title: FSharp.Data
content.body: Provides type providers for data access, including CSV, HTML, JSON, and XML formats, as well as HTTP requests.

content.title: FSharp.Stats
content.body: A library for statistical computing in F#, offering tools for data analytics and statistical testing.

content.title: ML.NET
content.body: An open-source, cross-platform machine learning framework for .NET developers to create custom ML models.

content.title: Accord.NET
content.body: A framework for scientific computing in .NET, encompassing numerical linear algebra, optimization, statistics, and more.

content.title: Math.NET Numerics
content.body: An open-source numerical library for .NET and Mono, providing methods and algorithms for numerical computations.

content.title: MBrace
content.body: A .NET open-source framework and runtime for large-scale computations in cloud computing environments.

content.title: FsLab
content.body: A collection of F# packages for data science, including data access, analysis, visualization, and machine learning tools.

content.title: DiffSharp
content.body: An automatic differentiation library for F#, providing exact and efficient gradients for machine learning and optimization.

content.title: FsAlg
content.body: A lightweight linear algebra library supporting generic types, enabling writing generic linear algebra code with custom numeric types.

content.title: Ariadne
content.body: A library for fitting Gaussian process regression models in F#, facilitating advanced statistical modeling.

content.title: Numl
content.body: A machine learning library intended to ease the use of standard modeling techniques for both prediction and clustering.

content.title: Deep.Net
content.body: A deep learning library for F# offering symbolic model differentiation, automatic differentiation, and compilation to CUDA GPUs.

content.title: m2cgen
content.body: A CLI tool to transpile trained classic ML models into native F# code with zero dependencies.

content.title: Math.NET Symbolics
content.body: A basic open-source computer algebra library for .NET, Silverlight, and Mono, written entirely in F#.

content.title: SIMDArray
content.body: SIMD-enhanced array extensions for faster computation in F#.

content.title: Synapses
content.body: A neural network library in F#, facilitating the creation and training of neural networks.

content.title: IfSharp
content.body: F# for Jupyter Notebooks, enabling interactive data analysis and visualization.

content.title: MATLAB (F# Type Provider)
content.body: An F# type provider for higher-fidelity integration between F# and MATLAB.

content.title: Python (F# Type Provider)
content.body: A Python type provider for F#, enabling integration with Python libraries.

content.title: Vulpes
content.body: A machine learning application using a deep belief network and connecting to NVIDIA GPUs via Alea.cuBase.

content.title: Suave
content.body: A simple web development F# library providing a lightweight web server and combinators to manipulate route flow and task composition.

content.title: WebSharper
content.body: An F#-based web programming platform including a compiler from F# code to JavaScript.

content.title: Fable
content.body: An F# to JS compiler designed to generate clean and standard code, integrating with JS development pipelines.

content.title: Fracture I/O
content.body: A high-performance sockets library.

content.title: Fracture.Http
content.body: An HTTP server built on Fracture I/O.

content.title: Frank
content.body: Provides a functional wrapper around the types in System.Net.Http, the library used by ASP.NET Web API.

content.title: Freya
content.body: F# support for OWIN; a functional web stack built on top of OWIN, offering additional layers for constructing OWIN pipelines.

content.title: FsBlog
content.body: A blog-aware, static site generator using F#, inspired by Jekyll and Octopress.

content.title: Firm
content.body: A blog-aware, static site generator using F#, supporting stand-alone pages, blog posts, RSS, tags, and post archive.

content.title: Falco
content.body: A functional micro-library for building ASP.NET Core applications using F#, with a low barrier to entry for those new to functional programming.

content.title: Interstellar
content.body: Enables the creation of cross-platform browser-based applications, abstracting around various browser APIs.

content.title: OpenSilver
content.body: An open-source framework designed to facilitate the development of rich internet applications using C# and XAML, now supporting F#.

content.title: Bistro Framework
content.body: A compositional .NET MVC framework incorporating concepts from REST and AOP, supporting controllers written in F#.

content.title: Giraffe
content.body: An F# micro web framework for building rich web applications, leveraging ASP.NET Core's features.

content.title: Saturn
content.body: An F# web framework built on top of Giraffe and ASP.NET Core, offering a developer-friendly experience.

content.title: Bolero
content.body: A web framework for F# that allows building interactive web applications using WebAssembly and Blazor.

content.title: Xelmish
content.body: Combines XNA with Elmish for 2D game development in F#, enabling functional game architecture.

content.title: Garnet
content.body: Lightweight F# game composition library featuring entity-component-system (ECS) and actor-like messaging.

content.title: Nu Game Engine
content.body: Cross-platform F# 2D game engine built in the functional style, utilizing SDL2 and Farseer Physics.

content.title: FsUnity
content.body: F# libraries, tools, and plugins designed for the Unity3d Game Engine.

content.title: fsharp-gamecore
content.body: Provides a fleshed-out game loop from MonoGame with supporting classes for 2D games.

content.title: GoDot
content.body: Tutorial on integrating F# with the Godot game engine for game development.

content.title: Fabulous
content.body: An open-source framework for building mobile and desktop apps using functional programming with F#. It uses the Model-View-Update (MVU) architecture.

content.title: Xamarin
content.body: A framework for building cross-platform apps using C#, F#, or Visual Basic. It allows developers to create native apps for iOS and Android.

content.title: Fable
content.body: A framework that allows using F# for web and mobile development with React, React Native, and HTML5.

content.title: MonoGame
content.body: An open implementation of a cross-platform gaming framework originally based on XNA. It supports F# for game development.

content.title: Avalonia.FuncUI
content.body: An F# Model-View-Update framework for functional cross-platform UI development.

content.title: Elmish.WPF
content.body: A production-ready library for building WPF apps with the MVU architecture.

content.title: Windows Forms
content.body: A framework for building Windows desktop applications directly with F#.

content.title: WPF
content.body: A framework for building Windows desktop applications directly with F#.

content.title: FsXaml
content.body: A library for using XAML with F# in WPF applications.

content.title: Bolero
content.body: A framework that brings F# to WebAssembly using Blazor.

content.title: Interstellar
content.body: A simple F# wrapper around web browsers for desktop apps.

content.title: SpiderEye
content.body: A cross-platform wrapper for hosting web content in desktop apps.

content.title: Farmer
content.body: An infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tool for F# that simplifies the deployment of Azure resources, allowing for declarative and reproducible cloud infrastructure setups.

content.title: FsHttp
content.body: A functional HTTP client library for F#, facilitating communication with cloud-based APIs and services.

content.title: FsCheck
content.body: A property-based testing framework for F#, valuable for ensuring the reliability and correctness of cloud-based systems through automated testing.

content.title: Azure Functions with F#
content.body: The ability to develop serverless functions using F# within the Azure Functions platform, enabling event-driven cloud computing.

content.title: Azure SDK for .NET
content.body: While not F# specific, the Azure SDK for .NET is fully compatible with F#, allowing developers to interact with a wide range of Azure cloud services.

content.title: AWS SDK for .NET
content.body: Similar to the Azure SDK, the AWS SDK for .NET can be used within F# applications to access and manage AWS cloud resources.

content.title: Amazon.SWF.Extensions
content.body: Extension to Amazon SDK’s SimpleWorkflow capabilities to make it more intuitive to use.

content.title: DynamoDB.SQL
content.body: SQL-like external DSL for querying and scanning Amazon DynamoDB.

content.title: Fog
content.body: Fog brings the cloud down to earth and wraps it in something more easily used by F#. It provides a more functional approach to creating Windows Azure apps with F#.

content.title: FSharp.Azure
content.body: FSharp.Azure provides an idiomatic F# API to query and modify data in Azure table storage using immutable F# record types.

content.title: S3 Type Provider
content.body: An experimental type provider for Amazon S3.

content.title: Azure Storage Type Provider
content.body: A type provider for Azure Storage assets e.g. Blobs and Tables.

content.title: FsDecider
content.body: F# computation expression builder for AWS Simple Workflow deciders.

content.title: FsFirestore
content.body: Functional F# library to access Firestore database hosted on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Firebase.

content.title: Chia
content.body: Chia is a F# library which contains HelperFunctions for reporting, logging and Azure cloud operations.

content.title: FsCheck
content.body: A property-based testing framework for F#, enabling the generation of test cases based on defined properties.

content.title: FsUnit
content.body: A unit testing library for F# that provides a fluent assertion syntax, making tests more readable and maintainable.

content.title: Expecto
content.body: A fluent testing framework for F# that emphasizes readability and expressiveness, offering a clean syntax for writing tests.

content.title: NUnit
content.body: A popular unit testing framework for .NET, widely used in F# projects for writing and running unit tests.

content.title: xUnit.net
content.body: A modern unit testing framework for .NET, compatible with F# and known for its extensibility and parallel test execution.

content.title: Canopy
content.body: A browser automation and testing framework for F#, enabling end-to-end testing of web applications.

content.title: TickSpec
content.body: A behavior-driven development (BDD) framework for F#, allowing you to write executable specifications using a natural language syntax.

content.title: ArbSharp
content.body: A library for generating arbitrary test data in F#, often used in conjunction with property-based testing frameworks like FsCheck.

content.title: Unquote
content.body: A lightweight assertion library for F# that provides a concise syntax for writing assertions.

content.title: Visual Studio
content.body: The official IDE from Microsoft, providing comprehensive F# support, including debugging, IntelliSense, and project management.

content.title: VS Code (Ionide Plugin)
content.body: A VS Code plugin that provides F# language support, including IntelliSense, code navigation, and debugging. It is the core plugin for F# development in VS Code.

content.title: Rider
content.body: A cross-platform .NET IDE from JetBrains with excellent F# support, including code analysis, refactoring, and debugging.

content.title: Emacs (F# Mode)
content.body: A highly customizable text editor with an F# mode that provides syntax highlighting, indentation, and basic language support.

content.title: Vim (F# Plugins)
content.body: A highly configurable text editor with various plugins that provide F# language support, including syntax highlighting and code completion.

content.title: Sublime Text (F# Package)
content.body: A sophisticated text editor with a package that provides F# syntax highlighting and basic language support.

content.title: Atom (Ionide-Atom Plugin)
content.body: Before Atom was archived, Atom had the Ionide-Atom plugin that provided F# support. While Atom is no longer being developed, users may still use it.

content.title: Neovim (F# LSP)
content.body: Neovim, a modern fork of Vim, can be configured to use the F# Language Server Protocol (LSP) for advanced F# support.

content.title: F# Interactive (FSI)
content.body: The F# Interactive tool, available in the F# compiler, allows for interactive F# scripting and exploration of code snippets.

content.title: IfSharp
content.body: An F# kernel for Jupyter Notebooks, enabling interactive data analysis and visualization within the Jupyter environment.
